author: Staff Reporter
text:
Deposit quarried sand on riverbed

Villagers of Kandaneri and Kavanur laid siege to sand lorries at a quarry in Palar riverbed on Friday.

M. Raman of Palar Protection Awareness Movement said the government has permitted a sand quarry on Palar riverbed at Kandaneri and Kavanur villages.

“This is the second time that sand quarrying has been permitted at this place. A quarry operated here nearly four years ago, and sand was dug up for nearly eight feet,” he said.

The villagers have been opposing the quarry since it was proposed for the second time.

“However, the quarry started to operate two days ago and sand is being dug up day and night,” he said.

About 100 villagers laid siege to 30 sand-laden lorries at the quarry.

They removed the sand from the lorries and deposited it on the riverbed.

“We are demanding that the government cancels the permission for the quarry,” he added.

Want government to cancel permission for the quarry at Kandaneri and Kavanur
title: Villagers lay siege to sand lorries
